title: Wychwood Way Walking Route

images.title: Philip Halling / The Wychwood Way, Combe
images.caption: Here the trail is pictured to the east of the village of Combe.

images.title: Andy Stephenson / Western entrance to the Blenheim Estate
images.caption: Western entrance of the Oxfordshire Way and Wychwood Way long-distance footpaths to the Blenheim Estate in Oxfordshire. At this point the two paths follow the course of Akeman Street. The park wall forms part of the parish boundary between Blenheim and Stonesfield.

images.title: Simon Burchell, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A photo of the footpath marker

images.title: David Luther Thomas / View across field
images.caption: View across field. The trees on the horizon mark the course of the Wychwood Way.

images.title: Andy Stephenson / Ascott d’Oyley
images.caption: Ascott d'Oyley, Ascott-under-Wychwood, Oxfordshire: remains of the earthworks of the motte-and-bailey castle (foreground) and part of the Manor House (background). The manor house is a mixture of 13th, 16th and 17th century phases of building.

images.title: Wychwood Way through Blenheim Park by David P Howard, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The trail through Blenheim Park

images.title: andrew auger / The Wychwood Way off the B4026
images.caption: A restricted byway between Chipping Norton and Spelsbury.

images.title: Philip Halling / The Wychwood Way, Combe
images.caption: The trail to the east of the village of Combe.

description: A long circular walk exploring the Wychwood Forest area of the Cotswolds. The walk starts in Woodstock and visits Stonesfield, Chadlington, Ascott-under-Wychwood, Leafield, Ramsden, North Leigh, East End and Combe. Highlights on the route include the magnifcent Blenheim Park at Woodstock. The route links with the Shakespeare's Way and Oxfordshire Way long distance trails.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: In Chadlington you could enjoy a pit stop at Tite Inn. The historic stone pub dates back to the 1600s and includes a fine restaurant and a glorious garden for warmer days. You can find them at postcode OX7 3NY for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Cotswolds Walks and the Oxfordshire Walks pages.

display_address: Fishery Cottage, Manor Road, Old Woodstock, Woodstock, West Oxfordshire, Oxfordshire, England, OX20 1XR, United Kingdom
